metadata.title: CVE-2020-26951 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.description:
A parsing and event loading mismatch in Firefox's SVG code could haveallowed load events to fire, even after sanitization. An attacker alreadycapable of exploiting an XSS vulnerability in privileged internal pagescould have used this attack to bypass our built-in sanitizer. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 83, Firefox ESR < 78.5, and Thunderbird <78.5.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26951` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 83.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '83.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:78.5.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
